name: Thank you for being a friend!

cards.title: devastatingly
cards.example: Well, nobody ever believes me when I'm telling the truth. I guess it's the curse of every devastatingly beautiful woman.
cards.description: In a way that causes great damage or severe emotional impact; intensely.

cards.title: heritage
cards.example: Flirting is part of my heritage.
cards.description: Property, traditions, or features passed down from previous generations; cultural inheritance.

cards.title: expulsion
cards.example: We're sorry, Dorothy, but the bylaws clearly state that any derogatory remarks about the King are grounds for immediate expulsion.
cards.description: The act of officially forcing someone to leave a place, organization, or country.

cards.title: phony
cards.example: That phony hair color won't wash out just because you got caught in the rain!
cards.description: Not real or true; intended to deceive; also, a person who is insincere.

cards.title: pondering
cards.example: People waste their time pondering whether a glass is half empty or half full. Me, I just drink whatever's in the glass.
cards.description: The act of thinking about something carefully, especially before making a decision.

cards.title: disguises
cards.example: Why do blessings wear disguises? If I were a blessing, I'd run around naked.
cards.description: Things that alter appearance to hide identity; also, the act of concealing the true nature of something.

cards.title: herring
cards.example: You know what they say: You can lead a herring to water, but you have to walk really fast or he'll die.
cards.description: A silvery, oily fish found in northern seas; often eaten salted or smoked.

cards.title: revered
cards.example: We not only took care of our old people, we revered them, honored them, put them on a pedestal. 'Course, that's how we got to be the broken hip capital of the Midwest.
cards.description: Regarded with great respect and admiration.

cards.title: wretched
cards.example: When a person dies, you go to their funeral to show the man upstairs you have respect for human life, no matter how wretched it was. Any idiot knows that.
cards.description: In a very unhappy or unfortunate state; of poor quality; despicable.

cards.title: sag
cards.example: No matter how bad things get, remember these sage words: You're old, you sag, get over it.
cards.description: To sink, bend, or droop from weight or lack of strength.

cards.title: dentures
cards.example: May you put your dentures in upside down and chew your head off.
cards.description: A removable plate or frame holding artificial teeth.

cards.title: toupee
cards.example: "Sophia, you're looking younger every day." — "Hi, Stan, and that's a beautiful toupee you're wearing. Great, now we're both liars."
cards.description: A small wig or hairpiece worn to cover a bald spot.

cards.title: herring (war)
cards.example: Blanche: "The Great Herring War?" — Rose: "Between the Lindstroms and the Johannsens." — Dorothy: "Oh, that Great Herring War."
cards.description: A humorous phrase referring to a family dispute about herring (from the show); not a standard dictionary term.

cards.title: cagey
cards.example: Can you believe it? After four long years, my baby girl is finally coming to see me. I'm so happy, I could cry. — But Blanche, you are crying! — Admit it, Rose, you worked for Allied Intelligence during World War II. — Huh? — Fine. Play it cagey.
cards.description: Reluctant to share information; cleverly evasive or cautious.

cards.title: titillating
cards.example: How does it feel to have your butt whipped? — Well, sometimes I find it strangely titillating, but... oh. You were talking to her.
cards.description: Stimulating mild excitement or interest, often of a sexual nature.

cards.title: derogatory
cards.example: Any derogatory remarks about the King are grounds for immediate expulsion.
cards.description: Expressing a low opinion; showing a lack of respect or demeaning someone.

cards.title: harlot
cards.description: An archaic and offensive term for a promiscuous woman or a prostitute.

cards.title: bayou
cards.example: They'll find me in a little shack in the Louisiana bayou.
cards.description: A slow-moving, marshy waterway common in the southern United States, especially Louisiana.
